services_list.short_description: Complete dermatological evaluation and personalized treatment plan
Facial wrinkle reduction with botulinum toxin injections
Comprehensive acne management including medication and procedural treatments
Skin renewal treatment for improved texture and tone
Permanent hair reduction using advanced laser technology

carousel_items.alt: Comfortable waiting room with natural lighting
carousel_items.caption: Comfortable waiting area

short_bio: Dr. María López is a board-certified dermatologist with over 12 years of experience specializing in medical and cosmetic dermatology. She is passionate about helping patients achieve healthy, beautiful skin through evidence-based treatments and personalized care. Dr. López stays at the forefront of dermatological advances by regularly attending international conferences and incorporating the latest technologies into her practice.
long_bio: After completing her medical degree at the Universidad de Guadalajara, Dr. López pursued specialized training in dermatology at the prestigious Hospital Civil de Guadalajara. She further refined her skills in cosmetic dermatology through advanced training programs in the United States and Europe. Dr. López is committed to providing comprehensive care that addresses both the medical and aesthetic concerns of her patients. She believes in educating patients about their skin conditions and working collaboratively to develop effective treatment plans. Outside of her practice, Dr. López volunteers at community health clinics providing dermatological care to underserved populations.

education_items.notes: Advanced training in laser and injectable treatments

certificate_images.alt: Medical degree from Universidad de Guadalajara

clinic_info.address: Av. Américas 1500, Colonia Providencia, Guadalajara, Jalisco 44630, Mexico

faqs.question: Do you accept insurance?
faqs.answer: Yes, we accept most major insurance plans. Please contact our office with your insurance information to verify coverage before your appointment.

faqs.question: What should I bring to my first appointment?
faqs.answer: Please bring a valid ID, your insurance card (if applicable), a list of current medications, and any relevant medical records or previous test results. Arrive 15 minutes early to complete paperwork.

faqs.question: Do you offer virtual consultations?
faqs.answer: Yes, we offer teleconsultations for initial evaluations and follow-up appointments. Virtual visits are convenient and can address many dermatological concerns remotely.

faqs.question: How much does a consultation cost?
faqs.answer: A general consultation is $40. This fee may be applied toward treatment if you proceed with services on the same day. We also offer package pricing for multiple treatments.

faqs.question: What is your cancellation policy?
faqs.answer: We require at least 24 hours notice for cancellations or rescheduling. Late cancellations or no-shows may incur a fee.

faqs.question: Are cosmetic treatments safe?
faqs.answer: All our cosmetic treatments are performed using FDA-approved products and techniques. Dr. López will discuss potential risks and benefits during your consultation and ensure you're a good candidate for any procedure.

faqs.question: How long do Botox results last?
faqs.answer: Botox results typically last 3-4 months. Individual results may vary based on factors like metabolism, muscle activity, and the treated area. We recommend maintenance treatments to sustain optimal results.
